snippet: An ethnic integration problem that had been festering in the background for years at East Hampton High School has been brought to the forefront by student suicides.
abstract: Three suicides in three years have focused officials at East Hampton High School on the alienation of many immigrant students; all of students who killed themselves were Hispanic; suicides, taken together, bring to surface a division between the relatively small and economically comfortable Anglo-Saxons for whom the Long Island school was founded and its newer, poorer Hispanic residents, whose numbers have been rising rapidly.
lead_paragraph: An ethnic integration problem that had been festering in the background for years at East Hampton High School has been brought to the forefront by student suicides.

headline.seo: In Hamptons, Ethnicity, Class and Suicide Lead School to Reach Out
headline.main: Ethnicity, Class and Suicide Lead a Hamptons School to Reach Out
headline.print_headline: Ethnicity, Class and Suicide Lead Hamptons School to Reach Out
